contentrichtext.text: {{Infobox settlement |official_name = South Vinemont, Alabama |settlement_type = [[Town]] |image_skyline = |imagesize = |image_caption = |image_seal = |image_map = Cullman_County_Alabama_Incorporated_and_Unincorporated_areas_South_Vinemont_Highlighted.svg |mapsize = 250px |map_caption = Location in [[Cullman County, Alabama|Cullman County]] and the state of [[Alabama]] |image_map1 = |mapsize1 = |map_caption1 = |coordinates_region = US-AL |subdivision_type = [[List of countries|Country]] |subdivision_type1 = [[US state|State]] |subdivision_type2 = [[List of counties in Alabama|County]] |subdivision_name = [[United States]] |subdivision_name1 = [[Alabama]] |subdivision_name2 = [[Cullman County, Alabama|Cullman]] |government_type = |leader_title = |leader_name = |established_date = |area_magnitude = |area_total_km2 = 1.7 |area_total_sq_mi = 0.7 |area_land_km2 = 1.7 |area_land_sq_mi = 0.7 |area_water_km2 = 0 |area_water_sq_mi = 0 |elevation_ft = 1017 |elevation_m = 310 |population_as_of = 2000 |population_footnotes = |population_total = 425 |population_metro = |population_density_km2 = 250 |population_density_sq_mi = 607.1 |timezone = [[Central Time Zone (North America)|Central (CST)]] |utc_offset = -6 |latd = 34 |latm = 14 |lats = 1 |latNS = N |longd = 86 |longm = 51 |longs = 46 |longEW = W |timezone_DST = CDT |utc_offset_DST = -5 |postal_code_type = |postal_code = |area_code = |blank_name = [[Federal Information Processing Standard|FIPS code]] |blank_info = 01-71900 |blank1_name = [[Geographic Names Information System|GNIS]] feature ID |blank1_info = 0134967 |footnotes = |website = }} '''South Vinemont''' is a town in [[Cullman County, Alabama|Cullman County]], [[Alabama]], [[United States]]. At the 2000 census the population was 425. ==Geography== South Vinemont is located at {{Coord|34|14|1|N|86|51|46|W|type:city}} (34.233641, -86.862916){{GR|1}}. According to the [[U.S. Census Bureau]], the town has a total area of 0.6 square miles (1.7 km²), all of it land. ==Demographics== As of the [[census]]{{GR|2}} of 2000, there were 425 people, 180 households, and 115 families residing in the town. The [[population density]] was 651.6 people per square mile (252.5/km²). There were 203 housing units at an average density of 311.2 per square mile (120.6/km²). The racial makeup of the town was 94.59% [[Race (United States Census)|White]], 0.47% [[Race (United States Census)|Black]] or [[Race (United States Census)|African American]], 1.41% [[Race (United States Census)|Native American]], 0.24% from [[Race (United States Census)|other races]], and 3.29% from two or more races. 4.00% of the population were [[Race (United States Census)|Hispanic]] or [[Race (United States Census)|Latino]] of any race. There were 180 households out of which 25.6% had children under the age of 18 living with them, 52.2% were [[Marriage|married couples]] living together, 6.7% had a female householder with no husband present, and 36.1% were non-families. 31.7% of all households were made up of individuals and 12.2% had someone living alone who was 65 years of age or older. The average household size was 2.36 and the average family size was 2.93. In the town the population was spread out with 22.1% under the age of 18, 10.4% from 18 to 24, 27.5% from 25 to 44, 25.9% from 45 to 64, and 14.1% who were 65 years of age or older. The median age was 37 years. For every 100 females there were 90.6 males. For every 100 females age 18 and over, there were 94.7 males. The median income for a household in the town was $26,806, and the median income for a family was $35,000. Males had a median income of $30,250 versus $16,250 for females. The [[per capita income]] for the town was $16,141. About 11.1% of families and 16.5% of the population were below the [[poverty line]], including 10.1% of those under age 18 and 18.2% of those age 65 or over. ==Education== Vinemont High School serves 323 students in grades 9-12. Its mascot is an eagle, and the school colors are red, white and blue. It is a part of the [[Cullman County Board of Education]].<ref>{{Cite web |url= http://www.ccboe.org/school-list |title=School List |work=Cullman County Board of Education |accessdate=November 4, 2010 }}</ref> == References == {{reflist}} {{Coord|display=title|34.233641|-86.862916}} {{Cullman County, Alabama}} [[Category:Populated places in Cullman County, Alabama]] [[Category:Towns in Alabama]]
